docs.abstract: He was told he would lose. In any other year, he probably would have. But 2001 was not any other year.
docs.snippet: He was told he would lose. In any other year, he probably would have. But 2001 was not any other year.
docs.lead_paragraph: Michael R. Bloomberg was not entirely picky.

headline.main: How a String of Flukes Helped Pave the Way for Mayor Michael Bloomberg
headline.print_headline: Bloomberg’s First Race as a Billionaire Underdog

byline.original: By Matt Flegenheimer and Maggie Haberman

docs.abstract: The billionaire has deployed his corporation in service of his presidential bid, producing slick events and recruiting staff members with unusually high pay and other perks.
docs.snippet: The billionaire has deployed his corporation in service of his presidential bid, producing slick events and recruiting staff members with unusually high pay and other perks.
docs.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — In a warehouse covered in murals in the Design District here, cater waiters served wine and platters of Cuban sandwiches, summer rolls and kosher pigs in a blanket. They wore all black but for red, white and blue T-shirts reading “I Like Mike Bloomberg.”

headline.main: The Bloomberg Campaign Is a Waterfall of Cash
headline.print_headline: Cash and Perks For Aides Buoy Bloomberg Bid

docs.abstract: The Democratic candidates are all debating a singular issue. New polls offer insights, not answers.
docs.snippet: The Democratic candidates are all debating a singular issue. New polls offer insights, not answers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. I’m Giovanni Russonello, your morning newsletter writer taking over your afternoon edition.

headline.main: Who Can Beat Trump? Who Knows?
headline.print_headline: The Elephant in the Room: Electability

docs.abstract: He leads in the delegate race after Iowa and New Hampshire. But the map is dramatically expanding ahead of Super Tuesday and so are the costs of campaigning.
docs.snippet: He leads in the delegate race after Iowa and New Hampshire. But the map is dramatically expanding ahead of Super Tuesday and so are the costs of campaigning.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the compressed and crucial weeks between the New Hampshire primary and Super Tuesday, Pete Buttigieg is moving aggressively to replenish his campaign coffers with an ambitious schedule of 10 fund-raisers held across six states in a 14-day period.

headline.main: Pete Buttigieg’s Dash for Cash: 10 Fund-Raisers in Two Weeks

docs.abstract: Speculation on a comeback and debate fallout: This is your morning tip sheet.
docs.snippet: Speculation on a comeback and debate fallout: This is your morning tip sheet.
docs.lead_paragraph: Chasten Buttigieg whispered to his husband, Pete Buttigieg, during a commercial break in a town hall event at the University of Southern California in Los Angeles.

headline.main: On Politics: Is Warren Back in It?

docs.abstract: Speaking at a prominent synagogue near Miami, the former New York City mayor spoke of his Jewish heritage and his support for Israel.
docs.snippet: Speaking at a prominent synagogue near Miami, the former New York City mayor spoke of his Jewish heritage and his support for Israel.
docs.lead_paragraph: AVENTURA, Fla. — Michael R. Bloomberg on Sunday addressed rising anti-Semitism and spoke personally of his Jewish heritage in a speech at a prominent synagogue near Miami, a sign that courting Jewish voters is core to his strategy of building support in Florida.

headline.main: Bloomberg Warns of Anti-Semitism ‘Rearing Its Ugly Head’
headline.print_headline: In Florida, Bloomberg Courts Jewish Voters and Addresses Anti-Semitism

byline.original: By Rebecca R. Ruiz and Elizabeth Dias

docs.abstract: A day after they seemed to have brokered a truce, Joe Biden released a video criticizing “Bernie’s negative attacks” and Bernie Sanders responded with one blasting his rival’s record on Social Security.
docs.snippet: A day after they seemed to have brokered a truce, Joe Biden released a video criticizing “Bernie’s negative attacks” and Bernie Sanders responded with one blasting his rival’s record on Social Security.
docs.lead_paragraph: MASON CITY, Iowa — A day after former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Senator Bernie Sanders appeared to have brokered a truce after weeks of tension, Mr. Biden released a video on Tuesday night suggesting the Sanders campaign was engaging in “dishonest attacks” and Mr. Sanders responded with a video of his own criticizing Mr. Biden over his Social Security record.

headline.main: Biden and Sanders Trade Criticism Over Honesty, Social Security and Guns
headline.print_headline: Biden and Sanders Exchange Attack Videos, Ending Truce

docs.abstract: Ms. Williamson, a self-help author and spiritual adviser who ran for president, had viral debate moments but drew fire for her comments on science and medicine.
docs.snippet: Ms. Williamson, a self-help author and spiritual adviser who ran for president, had viral debate moments but drew fire for her comments on science and medicine.
docs.lead_paragraph: Marianne Williamson, the self-help author and spiritual adviser whose long-shot presidential campaign called for reparations and a Department of Peace, announced on Friday that she would drop out of the race.

headline.main: Marianne Williamson Drops Out of 2020 Race

docs.abstract: Ms. Williamson, a self-help author who dropped out of the Democratic presidential race this month, said she was not endorsing Mr. Yang per se, but wanted to help him get through the early primaries.
docs.snippet: Ms. Williamson, a self-help author who dropped out of the Democratic presidential race this month, said she was not endorsing Mr. Yang per se, but wanted to help him get through the early primaries.
docs.lead_paragraph: Marianne Williamson, the self-help author and spiritual adviser who exited the Democratic presidential race this month, said Thursday that she would support a fellow political outsider, Andrew Yang, in the upcoming Iowa caucuses to try to help him stay in the race beyond February.

headline.main: Marianne Williamson Says She’ll Support Andrew Yang in Iowa
headline.print_headline: Williamson Embraces Yang as a ‘Tuning Fork Realigning Us’

docs.abstract: The Granite State’s young people, libertarians and independent voters helped power Bernie Sanders to a primary victory in 2016. This time, some of them are eyeing Andrew Yang and Tulsi Gabbard.
docs.snippet: The Granite State’s young people, libertarians and independent voters helped power Bernie Sanders to a primary victory in 2016. This time, some of them are eyeing Andrew Yang and Tulsi Gabbard.
docs.lead_paragraph: PLYMOUTH, N.H. — Tim Smith is 35, relatively young compared with other voters. He calls himself an independent, which is common here in New Hampshire. And he’s uneasy about the political establishment and Democratic Party standard-bearers.

headline.main: Competing for Sanders’s New Hampshire Voters: Yang and Gabbard
headline.print_headline: Yang and Gabbard Siphoning Key Independents in New Hampshire
